definitions.definition: To cause a short circuit in (something).
examples: You should short the poles of the capacitor to discharge it before you work on it.

definitions.definition: To provide with an amount smaller than that agreed or labeled ; to shortchange .
examples: This is the third time I've caught them shorting us.

definitions.definition: To sell something, especially securities , that one does not own at the moment for delivery at a later date in hopes of profiting from a decline in the price; to sell short .

main_definition: ( transitive ) To cause a short circuit in (something).
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive , of an electrical circuit ) To short circuit .
( transitive , informal ) To provide with an amount smaller than that agreed or labeled ; to shortchange .

( transitive , business ) To sell something, especially securities , that one does not own at the moment for delivery at a later date in hopes of profiting from a decline in the price; to sell short .
